parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>RV</title><part><name>type</name>=<value>command

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> arma3

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>0.50

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Object Manipulation

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Returns whether the object is fully underwater<br><br>
<template lineStart="1"><title>Feature </title><part><name index="1"/><value> Informative </value></part><part><name index="2"/><value> This command works well with Arma 3 mini-submarines, which was the primary design goal most likely</value></part></template>

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> '''underwater''' object

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> object: [[Object]] - mini-submarine

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Boolean]] - [[true]] if submerged

</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>_isUnderwater = [[underwater]] [[vehicle]] [[player]];</code>

</value></part><part><name>x2</name>=<value> <code>_isUnderwater = [[eyePos]] [[player]] [[select]] 2 < 0;</code>

</value></part><part><name>seealso</name>=<value> [[isTouchingGround]], [[isAbleToBreathe]]
</value></part></template>

<comment><!-- CONTINUE Notes -->
</comment><dl class="command_description">
<dd class="notedate">Posted on February 2, 2017 - 18:08 (UTC)</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:Killzone Kid|Killzone Kid]]</dt>
<dd class="note"> This command is quite buggy with objects other than mini-subs. Code in Example 2 is a good alternative.
</dd>
</dl>
<comment><!-- DISCONTINUE Notes --></comment></root>
